methodology.framework: Comparative mythology + I Ching-based Human Design system
academic_foundations: I Ching (64 hexagrams â†’ 64 Human Design gates)
methodology.source_standards: Classical sources with named translators/editors, peer-reviewed astronomy, published UFO/ET contact literature with ISBN/DOI. V4: provisional vs locked citation status, explicit component tagging (C|G|U).

human_design_foundations: I Ching - 3,000+ years of scholarship (Wilhelm, Baynes, Jung)
64 DNA codons - Nobel-recognized genetic code work (Nirenberg, Khorana 1960s)
mathematical_correspondences: Binary yin/yang logic = Binary genetic code (A/T, C/G)

characteristics.trait: Liberation from captivity / intervention to free the bound (Andromeda chained, then freed by Perseus)

sources.title: Star Names: Their Lore and Meaning
sources.author: Richard Hinckley Allen
sources.summary: Describes constellation Andromeda as 'The Chained Woman', representing the mythic princess bound to a rock and rescued by Perseus.
sources.component_reasoning: Links classical myth of the chained royal daughter directly to constellation identity in naked-eye astronomy

sources.title: Andromeda (mythology)
sources.author: Ovid
sources.summary: Perseus sees Andromeda chained to a rock as sacrifice to a sea monster and rescues her in exchange for her hand in marriage.
sources.component_reasoning: Classical narrative encoding liberation from unjust bondage in the constellation Andromeda

sources.title: The Library (Bibliotheca)
sources.author: Apollodorus (Pseudo-Apollodorus)
sources.summary: Andromeda bound to rock as offering to sea monster; Perseus kills monster with Medusa's head and sets Andromeda free.
sources.component_reasoning: Greek mythographer describing myth that was mapped to constellation Andromeda

characteristics.trait: Andromeda as an extragalactic origin point / separate civilization space (M31 as 'island universe')

sources.title: Cepheids in the Andromeda Nebula
sources.author: Edwin Powell Hubble
sources.edition: Publications of the American Astronomical Society, Vol. 5
sources.location_hint: Discovery announcement and distance calculation based on Cepheid variables
sources.summary: Hubble's Cepheid variable observations in Andromeda showed it is extragalactic, establishing it as separate galaxy outside Milky Way.
sources.component_reasoning: Defines Andromeda Galaxy (M31) as distinct extragalactic system with independent stellar populations

sources.title: The Andromeda Galaxy as 'Island Universe'
sources.author: Historical astronomy community consensus
sources.summary: Andromeda confirmed as separate galaxy 2.5 million light-years distant, establishing extragalactic civilization possibility in speculative cosmology.
sources.component_reasoning: Establishes Andromeda as autonomous galactic system far beyond Milky Way boundaries

characteristics.trait: Non-hierarchical ethical council / anti-domination sovereignty doctrine (Andromedan Council narratives)

sources.title: Defending Sacred Ground: The Andromedan Compendium
sources.author: Alex Collier
sources.publisher: Brotherton Press / Leading Edge International Research
sources.location_hint: Chapters on Andromedan Council ethics and sovereignty directives
sources.summary: Describes Andromedan Council as anti-manipulation, pro-sovereignty collective opposing Earth control systems and hierarchical planetary governance.
sources.component_reasoning: Describes 'Andromedan Council' without clearly specifying constellation vs galaxy origin, framed as extragalactic oversight body

sources.title: Aliens Among Us? A Sociocultural Investigation of Extraterrestrial Belief Narratives
sources.author: Academic study (2025)
sources.edition: World Journal of Advanced Research and Reviews
sources.publisher: World Journal of Advanced Research and Reviews
sources.location_hint: Section on social and psychological functions of alien narratives
sources.summary: Analyzes contactee council claims as modern myth-making addressing psychological needs, not empirically verifiable encounters with extraterrestrials.
sources.component_reasoning: Frames 'Andromedan Council' narratives as cultural constructs rather than verified astronomical phenomena

characteristics.trait: Royal sacrifice and cosmic justice alignment (Andromeda as unjust ransom / innocence condemned)

sources.title: Metamorphoses
sources.author: Ovid (Publius Ovidius Naso)
sources.summary: Andromeda chained as sacrifice to sea monster due to her mother Cassiopeia's boast, encoding themes of inherited guilt and cosmic reparation.
sources.component_reasoning: Classical myth tied to constellation Andromeda encoding unjust punishment and cosmic law themes

sources.title: The Library (Bibliotheca)
sources.author: Apollodorus (Pseudo-Apollodorus)
sources.summary: Frames Andromeda as innocent victim forced to pay for her mother's hubris, establishing duty-guilt-ransom dynamic in the sky.
sources.component_reasoning: Greek mythological account establishing Andromeda constellation as symbol of unjust sacrifice and cosmic balance

disputed_points.claim: The Andromedan Council is actively guiding Earth governance and warning against hierarchical control.
disputed_points.counter_evidence: Academic analysis treats 'Andromedan Council' claims as unverifiable sociopolitical myth rather than demonstrable extraterrestrial intervention.

sources.title: Aliens Among Us? A Sociocultural Investigation of Extraterrestrial Belief Narratives
sources.author: Academic study (2025)
sources.location_hint: Section on social and psychological functions
sources.summary: Argues alien council narratives function as cultural mirrors addressing societal anxieties, not as scientific certainties about extraterrestrial governance.
sources.component_reasoning: Analyzes 'Andromedan' narratives as modern myth-making without establishing physical astronomical origin

research_notes: Patterns: (1) Classical myth encodes captivity, ransom, and liberation in the Andromeda constellation (Component C). (2) Modern astronomy reframes Andromeda (M31) as an external galaxy with independent stellar civilizations, establishing extragalactic distance and autonomy (Component G). (3) Contactee/channeled material attributes high ethics, anti-control doctrine, and council governance to 'Andromedans', often without falsifiable evidence and with ambiguous spatial origin (Component U). All sources are provisional pending full-text access verification.

classical_and_star_lore: Allen, R.H. (1899). Star Names: Their Lore and Meaning. G.E. Stechert & Co.
Apollodorus (c. 150 BCE). The Library (Bibliotheca). Loeb Classical Library (1921).
astronomy_and_extragalactic_research: Hubble, E.P. (1925). Cepheids in the Andromeda Nebula. Publications of the American Astronomical Society.
esoteric_and_contact_material: Collier, A. (1998). Defending Sacred Ground: The Andromedan Compendium. Brotherton Press / Leading Edge International Research.
academic_foundations: Wilhelm, R. & Baynes, C.F. (1950). The I Ching. Princeton University Press.
Nirenberg, M.W. & Khorana, H.G. (1960s). Genetic code research (Nobel-recognized).
Scholem, G. (1941). Major Trends in Jewish Mysticism. Schocken.
Feuerstein, G. (1998). The Yoga Tradition. Hohm Press.
Tarnas, R. (2006). Cosmos and Psyche. Viking.
critical_analysis: Academic study (2025). Aliens Among Us? A Sociocultural Investigation of Extraterrestrial Belief Narratives. World Journal of Advanced Research and Reviews. DOI: 10.30574/wjarr.2025.27.3.3112
